private_information: I can move disks: A, B, C, D
I am responsible for performing only moves that involve those disks
agent_1.goal: Help achieve the goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom C, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg empty; right peg top-to-bottom A, B, D

private_information: I can move disks: E, F, G
I am responsible for performing only moves that involve those disks
agent_2.goal: Help achieve the goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom C, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg empty; right peg top-to-bottom A, B, D

private_information: I can move disks: H, I, J
I am responsible for performing only moves that involve those disks
agent_3.goal: Help achieve the goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom C, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg empty; right peg top-to-bottom A, B, D

private_information: I coordinate the three agents and assemble their move sequences into a single valid plan
I produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver
orchestrator.goal: Produce a combined, valid plan and corresponding PDDL domain and problem that achieves the specified goal for the Tower of Hanoi instance

public_information: There are three pegs: left, middle, right.
There are 10 disks labeled A (smallest) through J (largest).
Initial configuration on the left peg from top to bottom is A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J.
Middle peg is empty and right peg is empty at the start.
The Tower of Hanoi rule applies: a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Agent move restrictions: agent_1 may only move disks A, B, C, D; agent_2 may only move disks E, F, G; agent_3 may only move disks H, I, J.
Goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom should be C, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg empty; right peg top-to-bottom should be A, B, D.

plan_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 participating in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi plan. You may only move disks A, B, C, D. Provide a strictly ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each primitive move must be formatted exactly as: 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Ensure every move respects the Tower of Hanoi rule that no larger disk is placed on a smaller disk and only involves your allowed disks. Do not produce PDDL. Base your plan on the public information and your private information.
plan_moves.prompt: You are agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide the ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, formatted as 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If you lack information, give moves that concern only disks you can move and do not assume additional facts.

plan_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 participating in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi plan. You may only move disks E, F, G. Provide a strictly ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each primitive move must be formatted exactly as: 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Ensure every move respects the Tower of Hanoi rule that no larger disk is placed on a smaller disk and only involves your allowed disks. Do not produce PDDL. Base your plan on the public information and your private information.
plan_moves.prompt: You are agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Provide the ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, formatted as 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If you lack information, give moves that concern only disks you can move and do not assume additional facts.

plan_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3 participating in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi plan. You may only move disks H, I, J. Provide a strictly ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each primitive move must be formatted exactly as: 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Ensure every move respects the Tower of Hanoi rule that no larger disk is placed on a smaller disk and only involves your allowed disks. Do not produce PDDL. Base your plan on the public information and your private information.
plan_moves.prompt: You are agent_3. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_3->goal}. Provide the ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, formatted as 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If you lack information, give moves that concern only disks you can move and do not assume additional facts.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator coordinating three agents for a Tower of Hanoi instance. You receive the ordered primitive moves proposed by each agent. Your task is to validate, merge, and, if necessary, adjust these move sequences so the combined plan is globally valid under the Tower of Hanoi rules and the agents move restrictions. Then produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownward planner that encode the validated multi-agent plan and the planning problem instance. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions attributable to the originating agents distinct (e.g., move_agent_1, move_agent_2, move_agent_3).
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Public information: {environment->public_information}. You will receive the ordered move lists from the three agents: {moves_agent_1}, {moves_agent_2}, {moves_agent_3}. Validate that each primitive move obeys the Tower of Hanoi rules and the agent disk restrictions. If conflicts or illegal moves are present, resolve them by reordering or requesting alternative valid moves in-line. After validation and integration, output a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that represent the instance and the allowed agent-specific move actions, targeting the FastDownward solver. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>. Keep the agents' actions distinct in the domain and map the integrated ordered primitive moves into an executable plan in the problem or comments as needed.
